unnormalised: Indian Railways (IR) announced a slew of measures aimed at improving passenger experience, as reported on 27/07/2024. These changes, effective immediately, target punctuality, cleanliness, and overall service quality across its vast network spanning from Kashmir to Kanyakumari.
normalised: I-R announced a slew of measures aimed at improving passenger experience, as reported on twenty seventh july two thousand and twenty four. These changes, effective immediately, target punctuality, cleanliness, and overall service quality across its vast network spanning from Kashmir to Kanyakumari.

unnormalised: Chief among the announcements is the introduction of "Project Swachh Rail," a nationwide initiative focusing on enhanced hygiene and sanitation standards within trains and railway stations. A budget of Rs. 500 crore has been allocated for the procurement of advanced cleaning equipment and the training of sanitation staff. This is in direct response to passenger feedback highlighting concerns about cleanliness, particularly in long-distance trains like the Rajdhani Express and Duronto Express.
normalised: Chief among the announcements is the introduction of "Project Swachh Rail," a nationwide initiative focusing on enhanced hygiene and sanitation standards within trains and railway stations. A budget of rupee five hundred crore has been allocated for the procurement of advanced cleaning equipment and the training of sanitation staff. This is in direct response to passenger feedback highlighting concerns about cleanliness, particularly in long-distance trains like the Rajdhani Express and Duronto Express.

unnormalised: Furthermore, IR has pledged to address the persistent issue of train delays. The "Mission Punctuality" program will leverage data analytics and real-time monitoring to identify and rectify bottlenecks in train operations. Authorities aim to reduce average delays by 15% within the next six months. Passengers can now track the live location of their trains using the IRCTC app, which provides updates every 5 minutes.
normalised: Furthermore, I-R has pledged to address the persistent issue of train delays. The "Mission Punctuality" program will leverage data analytics and real-time monitoring to identify and rectify bottlenecks in train operations. Authorities aim to reduce average delays by fifteen percent within the next six months. Passengers can now track the live location of their trains using the I-R-C-T-C app, which provides updates every five minutes.

unnormalised: In a move towards modernization, IR plans to equip all coaches with bio-toilets by 31/12/2024, minimizing environmental impact. Additionally, Wi-Fi connectivity is being expanded to cover all major railway stations, allowing passengers to stay connected during their journeys. Free Wi-Fi for 30 minutes is available to all passengers.

Free Wi-Fi for thirty minutes is available to all passengers.

unnormalised: Catering services are also undergoing a revamp. IRCTC has partnered with several food delivery platforms to offer a wider variety of meal options to passengers, delivered directly to their seats. Passengers can pre-order meals through the IRCTC website or app up to 2 hours before departure. A vegetarian thali costs Rs. 150, while a non-vegetarian option is priced at Rs. 200.
normalised: Catering services are also undergoing a revamp. I-R-C-T-C has partnered with several food delivery platforms to offer a wider variety of meal options to passengers, delivered directly to their seats. Passengers can pre-order meals through the I-R-C-T-C website or app up to two hours before departure. A vegetarian thali costs rupee one hundred and fifty, while a non-vegetarian option is priced at rupee two hundred.

unnormalised: To enhance safety and security, IR is installing CCTV cameras in all coaches and stations. The Railway Protection Force (RPF) will also increase its presence on trains and platforms to deter crime and ensure passenger safety. A dedicated helpline number, 139, is available 24/7 for passengers to report any issues or seek assistance.

The Railway Protection Force (R-P-F) will also increase its presence on trains and platforms to deter crime and ensure passenger safety. A dedicated helpline number, one hundred and thirty nine, is available twenty four seven for passengers to report any issues or seek assistance.

unnormalised: "These initiatives represent a significant step towards transforming Indian Railways into a world-class transportation system," stated Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw during a press conference held at Rail Bhavan, New Delhi. "Our commitment is to provide safe, comfortable, and punctual journeys for all our passengers." The Minister also highlighted that senior citizens above the age of 60 will continue to receive a 50% discount on train tickets.

unnormalised: In related news, the Ministry of Railways announced the launch of the "Bharat Gaurav Tourist Train," a special train designed to promote tourism and showcase India's rich cultural heritage. The train will cover various tourist circuits, including the Ramayana circuit and the Buddhist circuit. The first Bharat Gaurav train is scheduled to depart from Delhi on 15/08/2024. A 7-day tour package costs Rs. 25,000 per person.
